moves.1. e4 c5 2. b4: Left wing gambit, alternative to the traditionnal sicilian answer.
moves.8. Be2: 8. Qe2 was another option but white's plan is to get developpement advance by chasing the black queen.
moves.9. O-O: The black queen is not dangerous for the moment, the chase can wait.
moves.9... bxa3 10. Nxa3: A knight's move toward the edge is usually considered as bad but in this precise case, I thought it was ok, to protect the c pawn and enable a further Nb5
moves.10... Bc5: Black opts for an agressive line
moves.11... Qf4: The black queen is still exposed
moves.14... Qd7: Now the black queen is back home, black is still better on  the center but white has a lot of field.
moves.16. Bxf6 Nxe2+: To eliminate the pair bishop, I suppose but queen on e2 is not bad for white : semi open file in front of the black king, joining the rooks
moves.17. Qxe2: ... and menacing the unprotected e pawn.
moves.17... gxf6: Black strengthens his center but his king will be weak.
moves.18. Qf3: Menacing f6 and enabling a further Nf5
moves.18... Ke7: Black probably thinks that his king is better on the center now that both wings are unsafe.
moves.19. Rfe1: rook on the semi open file
moves.19... Qg4: Being one pawn up, black looks for queens exchange
moves.20. Qd5: Attacking the king by  his weak side
moves.20... Bxf2+: Black sees no proper place for his bishop and prefers to trade it to weaken the white king.
moves.21... Qxh4+ 22. Kg1: Back to his place. Now black is 2 pawns up but white has strong menaces available
moves.22... Kf8: To avoid the following nasty sequence : 23. Qd6+ Ke8 24. Nc7+mate
moves.23. Nc7: I hesitated. Black has material advantage but his pieces are poorly developped. I do not have to make him gain tempos to unblck his pieces.
moves.24. Qd8+: To send the black king on the open g file.
moves.24... Kg7 25. Ne8+ Kg6: So that the black king is vulnerable to a rook attack
moves.26. Qe7: To put the queen is safe
moves.27. Nd6: Menacing 28. Qxf7+, very anoying for black for, if 28. ... Kh6 29. Nxf5+ and the queen gets it, if 28. ... Kg8 29. Qxf6+ and black loses his bishop on the 30th move.
moves.28. Re3: menacing an attack toward king and/or queen
moves.28... Qd4: pinning the e rook and menacing the a one
moves.29... Bxd3: increasing the material advantage but naking the king
moves.30... Kg7: Black sees the danger and plans to hide on h8
moves.31. Rg3+: Black submits here (if 31. ... Bg6 32. Nf5+ and the black queen is lost. if 31. ... Kh8 32. Qxf6+mate
